title: Exam: Contactless Payments & Wearable Tech Security

questions.question: What does 'NFC' stand for in the context of mobile payments?
options: National Finance Corporation
Near Field Communication
Network Frequency Control
New Financial Contact
questions.explanation: NFC (Near Field Communication) es la tecnología inalámbrica de corto alcance para pagos.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses 'must' for security?
options: You must to lock your phone.
You must locking your phone.
You must lock your phone.
You musts lock your phone.
questions.explanation: Después de 'must', el verbo va en infinitivo sin 'to'.

questions.question: What is 'Tokenization'?
options: Exchanging physical coins for digital ones
Replacing sensitive card data with a unique identifier
A type of physical bank vault
A method of printing plastic cards
questions.explanation: La tokenización protege los datos de la tarjeta reemplazándolos con un código único.

questions.question: Choose the correct prohibition:
options: You mustn't share your digital wallet passcode.
You mustn't to share your digital wallet passcode.
You must not sharing your digital wallet passcode.
You don't must share your digital wallet passcode.
questions.explanation: 'Mustn't' se usa para prohibiciones seguido del verbo base.

questions.question: What is a 'Digital Wallet'?
options: A physical wallet with a solar panel
An application that stores payment information on a device
A website where you buy physical wallets
A ledger used by traditional accountants
questions.explanation: Una billetera digital es una app que guarda info de pago en un dispositivo.

questions.question: If you see a suspicious device on a payment terminal, you ______ use it.
options: must
can
mustn't
could
questions.explanation: No debes (mustn't) usar un terminal sospechoso.

questions.question: What are 'Biometrics' in payment security?
options: Physical signatures on paper
Biological data like fingerprints or face scans
The size and weight of a credit card
A list of your previous transactions
questions.explanation: La biometría usa datos biológicos como huellas o escaneos faciales.

questions.question: Which of these is an example of 'Wearable Tech'?
options: A desktop computer
A smartwatch with NFC
A traditional leather wallet
A physical ATM machine
questions.explanation: Un smartwatch es un ejemplo de tecnología vestible (wearable tech).

questions.question: What is 'Skimming'?
options: Reading a book very fast
Illegally capturing data from a card's magnetic stripe
Sending a digital receipt via email
Updating the software on your phone
questions.explanation: El skimming es la captura ilegal de datos de la banda magnética de una tarjeta.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'You ______ report a stolen device immediately.'
options: mustn't
must
can't
won't
questions.explanation: Es una obligación fuerte reportar un dispositivo robado (must report).

questions.question: What does 'Tap to Pay' refer to?
options: Paying with water from a tap
Contactless payment by touching a device to a reader
Typing a long password on a keyboard
Calling the bank to authorize a payment
questions.explanation: 'Tap to Pay' es el pago sin contacto al tocar un lector con el dispositivo.

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of 'Encryption'?
options: It makes the app look more beautiful
It protects data by converting it into a secret code
It increases the battery life of the phone
It allows you to print money at home
questions.explanation: El cifrado protege los datos convirtiéndolos en un código secreto.

questions.question: Identify the grammatically correct sentence:
options: We mustn't writing our PIN on the phone.
We mustn't write our PIN on the phone.
We mustn't to write our PIN on the phone.
We not must write our PIN on the phone.
questions.explanation: Mustn't + verbo base (write).

questions.question: Why is 'Find My Device' important for fintech users?
options: To find the nearest physical bank branch
To remotely lock or wipe a lost device with payment cards
To see where friends are shopping
To get discounts at local stores
questions.explanation: Permite bloquear o borrar remotamente un dispositivo perdido que tiene tarjetas.

questions.question: Which modal verb is used for strong internal obligation or a rule?
options: Can
May
Must
Could
questions.explanation: 'Must' se usa para obligaciones fuertes o reglas.

questions.question: What should you do before tapping your phone on a public reader?
options: Take a photo of the cashier
Ensure the terminal is secure and not tampered with
Shout your PIN out loud
Restart your phone three times
questions.explanation: Debes asegurarte de que el terminal sea seguro y no haya sido manipulado.

questions.question: A payment ring is an example of ______ technology.
options: ATM
Contactless wearable
Physical cash
Desktop
questions.explanation: Un anillo de pago es tecnología 'wearable' sin contacto.

questions.question: Correct the error: 'You mustn't sharing your Face ID.'
options: You mustn't share your Face ID.
You must share your Face ID.
You mustn't to share your Face ID.
You don't must share your Face ID.
questions.explanation: Se debe usar el verbo base 'share' después de 'mustn't'.

questions.question: What is the 'magnetic stripe' used for?
options: To make the card look shiny
To store data on traditional plastic cards
To attach the card to a refrigerator
To measure the temperature of the wallet
questions.explanation: La banda magnética guarda datos en las tarjetas plásticas tradicionales.

questions.question: If your smartwatch is stolen, you ______ deactivate the digital cards.
options: mustn't
must
won't
couldn't
questions.explanation: Debes desactivar las tarjetas digitales (must deactivate).
